visualization_prompt: Generate a boxplot showing distribution statistics with configurable whisker lengths using Highcharts' per-datapoint property overrides
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains three synthetic boxplot distributions demonstrating different whisker configurations. Each datapoint contains five-number summary statistics (low, Q1, median, Q3, high) with μ=36-54 and σ maintained through consistent interquartile ranges. Synthetic values follow a geometric progression (12n) to ensure mathematical coherence while focusing attention on whisker variations. The boxplot was selected as it efficiently shows distribution shape and outliers per Tukey's conventions. Per Tufte's principles, non-essential elements (legend, axis titles) were removed to maximize data-ink ratio. Cairo's perceptual principles were applied through sequential color coding (red→teal→blue) and whisker length differentiation (50%→150%→10%) for pre-attentive comparison. Fixed box width (60% IQR) and consistent dash patterns maintain visual rhythm while emphasizing the experimental whisker modifications.
